info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 26 at 12:18AM EST until further notice by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Transylvania County, North Carolina * WHEN...Until noon EST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Nuisance flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to streams and other poor-drainage areas, including farmland, parks, greenways, boat-access areas, golf courses, underpasses, and parking lots. Isolated, shallow flows over roadways is possible. A few flood-prone, low-water crossings may become impassible. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1153 PM EST, Light to moderate rainfall has persisted across Transylvania County since yesterday morning. Doppler radar and automated gauges indicate 2-5 inches of rain has accumulated over the past 12 hours. Isolated areas near Lake Toxaway have received nearly 6 inches of rainfall. Area streams are gradually rising and some are approaching bankfull or Action/Advisory Stage, including Little River near Penrose and the Davidson River above Pisgah Forest. At these levels nuisance flooding of adjacent low-lying areas is beginning, including near Cascade Lake Rd and Davidson River Rd. Additional streams are likely to exceed bankfull levels into the morning hours as rainfall and runoff continues. This includes the French Broad River and its headwaters from above Rosman to Brevard to Blantyre. Therefore, a Flood Advisory has been issued and will remain in place into Tuesday afternoon. - The French Broad River near Rosman is at 5.56 feet and rising slowly. Action/Advisory Stage is 7.0 feet. However, moderate rain rates have moved off to the north and east of Transylvania County so the French Broad River headwaters may temporarily crest over the next few hours at or below Action Stage if new areas of moderate rain do not develop. Similar conditions exist in the headwaters of the Little River near Cedar Mountain. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches is expected through Tuesday afternoon, with isolated totals exceeding 4 inches possible. This additional rainfall will likely cause area streams to approach and exceed Minor Flood Stage, resulting in more significant lowland flooding. If these conditions develop, a Flood Warning may be issued. Steps to protect vulnerable property adjacent to streams should be taken before flood waters develop and rise. Areas of heavier rainfall are also possible through Tuesday afternoon. Intense rainfall rates may result in an acceleration of stream rises as upper soils are already saturated from earlier rainfall. This may cause flash flooding to develop and a Flash Flood Warning may be necessary. If rapid stream rises are observed, avoid all low-lying areas near streams and be prepared to seek higher ground. - Some locations that may experience nuisance flooding include... Brevard, Rosman, Gorges State Park, Lake Toxaway, Dupont State Forest, Pisgah Forest, Connestee, Balsam Grove, Cedar Mountain, and Penrose. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
